CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas Kelly, candy store worker, East Liberty and Mrs. Mabel Rice, laundress, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "In your opinion what political party has done the most for the Negroes?" Mr. Thomas Kelly's answer reads: "The Democrats have done the most.  For instance, they were responsible for both the civil rights bills."  Mrs. Mabel Rice's with question: "In your opinion what political party has done the most for the Negroes?" answer reads: "The way I see it, we have progressed the most under the Democrats..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Thomas Kelly wearing dark suit jacket and hat, standing in front of storefront, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Mabel Rice wearing light colored blouse with M R monogram, standing in front of storefront, Smithfield Street, Downtown
